TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit DynamicDocumentPaginator extends System.Windows.Documents.DocumentPaginator
Public MustInherit Class DynamicDocumentPaginator Inherits DocumentPaginator

summary.span: 提供抽象基类，该抽象基类除了支持其自己基类的方法和属性之外，还支持自动后台分页和在重新分页期间跟踪内容位置。

span.span: Provides an abstract base class that supports automatic background pagination and tracking content positions across repaginations in addition to the methods and properties of its own base class.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 默认情况下， 会自动在后台对内容进行分页（当 `true`时，将开始此过程，这是默认设置）。By default, a will automatically pre-paginate content in the background (this process begins when is `true`, which is the default setting). `true` 时，布局也将书籍，因为内容更改或 更改。When is `true`, the layout will also be repaginated due to changes in content or changes in . 当完成一个或多个页面的分页（或重新分页）时， 事件发生，例如在下列情况下：The event occurs upon completion of pagination (or repagination) of one or more pages, such as in the following situations: - 在后台对内容进行分页时， 事件发生。 events occur as content is paginated in the background. 根据实现，事件可能发生在对一个或多个页进行分页时（ 指定已分页的页）。Depending on the implementation, the event may occur upon paginating one or multiple pages ( specifies which pages have been paginated). - 如果指定的页面尚未分页，则对 或 的调用可能导致发生 事件。Calls to or may cause an event to occur if the page specified has not been paginated. 例如，如果启用了后台分页（ = `true`），但分页只是在第三页完成，则调用带有6个参数的 将导致分页为4、5、6和7。For example, if background pagination is enabled ( = `true`) but pagination has only been completed up to the third page, a call of with an argument of 6 will cause pages four, five, six, and seven to be paginated. 完成后，将引发 事件，其 设置为 = 4， = 4。Upon completion, a event will be raised with settings of = 4 and = 4. - 启用后台分页（ = `true`）时，对流格式内容 的更改（例如 ）可能会导致重新分页并关联 事件。With background pagination enabled ( = `true`), a change in on flow-format content, such as a , may cause repagination and associated events. 请注意， 对固定格式的内容（如 ）不会有任何影响，但视觉对象大小不会影响布局。Note that has no effect in repagination on fixed-format content, such as , where the visual page size does not affect the layout. 禁用后台分页时也会发生 事件。A event also occurs when background pagination is disabled. 例如，如果只有一个内容页并且 = `false`），则使用参数0调用 将产生两个事件：For example, if there is only one page of content and = `false`), calling with an argument of 0 will result in two events: 1. 事件，其 设置为 = 0， = 1。A event with settings of = 0 and = 1. 2. 事件。A event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 如果 `contentPosition` 之前的页面尚未设置格式，则将在返回请求的页码之前同步分页。If pages prior to the `contentPosition` have not been formatted, they will be paginated synchronously prior to returning the requested page number. 提供与 类似的功能，但具有异步操作。 provides similar functionality as , but with asynchronous operation.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 取消此方法的异步操作的唯一方法是取消所有异步操作。The only way to cancel the asynchronous operation of this method is to cancel all asynchronous operations. 与此方法的其他重载相比： 。Contrast this with the other overload of this method: . 此方法引发 事件。This method raises the event. 页码作为事件参数之一传递到事件。The page number is passed to the event as one of the event arguments. 有关如何使用此方法获取页码的详细说明，请参阅 。See for how to use this method to get the page number.

remarks.format: ## Remarks 此方法重载可以取消此异步操作，而无需取消所有异步操作。This overload of the method makes it possible to cancel this asynchronous operation without cancelling all asynchronous operations. 此方法引发 事件。This method raises the event. 以下步骤演示了如何以异步方式检索给定 `contentPosition` 的页码。The following steps illustrate how to retrieve the page number of a given `contentPosition` asynchronously. 1. 创建 委托，并将其添加到 事件的通知。Create a delegate and add it to be notified of events. 2. 调用 指定所需 `contentPosition` 和将用于标识异步任务的唯一 `userState` 对象。Call specifying the `contentPosition` desired and a unique `userState` object that will be used to identify the asynchronous task. 3. 当发生事件并且调用委托时，将比较事件的 。When the event occurs and the delegate is called, compare the event's . 具有原始 `userState` 参数的属性。property with the original `userState` parameter. 4. 当 。When the . 属性匹配原始 `userState`，操作完成并且页码已准备就绪。property matches the original `userState`, the operation is complete and the page number is ready. （(The . 属性还将与原始 `contentPosition` 参数匹配。）property will also match the original `contentPosition` parameter.) 5. .The . 属性包含指定 `contentPosition`的从零开始的页码。property contains the zero-based page number of the specified `contentPosition`. 提供与 类似的功能，但用于同步操作。 provides similar functionality as , but for synchronous operation.

summary.span: 获取或设置一个值，该值指示是否在后台自动执行分页，以响应某些事件（如页大小的更改）。

span.span: Gets or sets a value indicating whether pagination is performed automatically in the background in response to certain events, such as a change in page size.

value.span: 如果已启用后台分页，则为 ；否则为 。

span.span: if background pagination is enabled; otherwise, .
The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks 当 `true`时，将在后台执行分页，并相应地引发 和 事件。When `true`, pagination is performed in the background, raising and events as appropriate. 与 不同，对 内容进行分页不受对视觉对象 的更改的影响。Pagination of content, as distinct from a is not affected by changes to the visual .
